availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Fowler (Hopkins County, Ky, farmer and barkeeper )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and barkeeper. North Carolina native. Son of John Fowler and Bethia Fowler. Married to Sarah J. Fowler. Father of Sarah J. Fowler. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Barkeeper in Webster County in 1860. Farmer in Madisonville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 167A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 476.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 3, p. 53B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, September 1863, p. 8.
"William Lafayette Fowler (1831-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #66826117, accessed November 3, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66826117.
